comments:
Build F1

If you attempt to examine a Table widget's items (e.g. getItems()) in the 
dispose callback for the Table, you'll get back null.

This is unfortunate, since the Table still answers false to isDisposed() until 
after the the widgetDisposed events are sent. Thus code which is run during 
the disposed callbacks has no way of knowing whether the Table is still valid 
or not.

I encountered this problem in my TableViewer. When the Table widget is 
disposed my viewer removes a listener from each model element. Removing the 
listener actually prompts the model element to send out one last notification, 
notifying all the listeners that a listener is about to be removed. My 
listener isn't very bright, so he thinks that the view might have changed and 
refreshes the item in the TableViewer. But the TableViewer throws a 
NullPointerException when it tries to find the item in the Table.

Correction - the NullPointerException actually originates in Table.getItems(), 
not in the TableViewer.

So getItems() doesn't return null as I originally reported; it throws a 
NullPointerException.

I believe I encounter some similar behaviour. Unfortunately I cannot reproduce
it with a simple sample.

Another strange thing is that it "seems" to behave differently on Windows and
with Motif. 

What happens is on Windows (f3):

here items is null.

If you want to reproduce the problem you can download the code from
http://sourceforge.net/project/showfiles.php?group_id=43627 . After restarting
eclipse you can just add the ResultView and when you shut down eclipse it will
appear everytime.

Probably it is my code causing the problem, but I don't have a clue how I could
do it.

I was going through the bugs I reported and found that I don't have the problem
anymore, that I described above. Don't remeber if I solved it in my code or if
it faded away during a new eclipse release, but it is not happening anymore.

Don't know about Peter's problem though.
